blocks.content: SQL Injection (SQLi) is a vulnerability that allows attackers to insert harmful SQL commands into a website's database query. In naval style, it is like sending a secret message through a ship’s communication channel to access restricted areas inside the ship’s control system.

content: Happens when user input is not filtered
Allows attackers to read or modify database data
Can lead to full server takeover

blocks.content: A website sends queries to a database. If the site does not validate user input, attackers can insert SQL commands. The database will run the injected commands thinking they are part of the normal query.

SQLMap is an automated SQL injection tool. We will use it only on safe lab targets like TryHackMe, DVWA, or your own test machines. In naval style, SQLMap is like deploying a drone that automatically checks every weak point in an enemy ship.

content: Why: Automatically tests for SQL injection in the parameter.
Why: Shows all databases inside the vulnerable server.
Why: Displays all tables inside a selected database.
Why: Retrieves usernames, passwords, or other sensitive data.

blocks.content: We will NOT use SQLMap on real websites. Only on lab targets. A training target behaves like a real server but is legal and safe for learning.
